label: aeris weather
info:
This flow requests data from the Aeris Weather API.

Requirements:

Four global variables are required for this flow to work:
    aw_client_id - the Aeris Weather client id
    aw_client_secret - the Aeris Weather client secret
    lattitude - lattitude in decimal degrees
    longitude - longitude in decimal degrees
    
Client id and secret can be obtained from:
https://account.aerisweather.com/account/apps

Lattidued and Longitude should be in decimal degrees,
not DMS format. For example for somewhere in the middle of Kansas lattidue owuld be 38.417647 and longitude would be 38.417647, -99.957065.

All of hese variables should be set on the "settings" page through the dashboard user interface.

To get free access to Aeris Weather you need to contribute weather data to them and this provides a small number of API calls per day (5,000 as of this writing. This dashboard currently conslumes around 1,000/day).

label: all sky
info: This flow gets the all sky image and readies it for display. The actual image is sent across MQTT as data, not the filename.

label: all sky history
info: This  load in the variious summary images and videos from the all sky package. The "get files" nodes should be updated to point to where they exist on your system.

label: alpaca common
info: This is for any Alpaca calls that we can handle with a common implementation. While there are many calls with the same name that each driver must implement they tend to require specific implementations for each driver and so are handled on the driver's flow.

label: alpaca discovery
info: This implements the ASCOM Alpaca discovery protocol. Or at least I hope it does. I had to reverse engineer it from network sniffing as it wasn't documented that I could find.

label: alpaca observing conditions
info:
This implements the ASCOM Alpaca observing conditions driver.

Although this technicall passes the compliance tests, it does not reallly implement average period. Averaging is not supported as data comes in from MQTT at about a once perminute rate.

label: alpaca safety monitor
info:
This flow implements the ASCOM Alpaca calls necessary to implement the Safety Monitor device.

Currently, this implementation is not compliant but it does work with NINA.

label: astrospheric
info:
This was an attempt to bring astrospheric into the dashboard. However, it does not work particularly well. It sometimes gets flagged for too many calls to astrospheric and there's no way to actually log in. Unfortunately, my support request to the author went unanswered.

I've disabled it for now but I've left it here in the hopes of revisiting it some day.

label: boltwood
info: This is no longer needed now that I have the mqtt-observing-conditions ascom driver but it maay be useful to others who want to get at least some weather data into ASCOM.

label: graphs
info: These graphs each keep two days of data. Graphs are loaded fron context data at startup. In the case of weather data, if context data does not exist, the ambient weather api is queried for up to two days of data.

label: nina
info:
This flow looks for the nina web server, first on the PC's ethernet address and then on the WiFi address.

This looks for the server provided by NINA's Web Session History Viewer to determine whether or not NINA is up.

label: pegasus astro data
info: I have a Pegasus Astro Uranus meteo sensor. Unfrotunately, the sky quality meter is not especially useful. The signal becomes very noisy the darker the sky becomes and it means that it doesn't make a good sky quality meter though its other sensors seem to behave better. Unfortunately, it isn't designed to be outside 24/7 so there isn't much point in hooking the other sensors up to the dashboard.

label: pushover
info:
This flow sends alerts to pushover if the "alert to pushover" setting is turned on. 

These are sent as normal priority alerts as I generate emergency alerts from within NINA. If you want emergency alerts here, change the priority in the alert to pushover node to 2.

Two environment variables need to be set:
ASTRODASH_PUSHOVER_USER_KEY
ASTRODASH_PUSHOVER_API_TOKEN

You can set these up at https://pushover.net

label: safety
info:
This flow evaluates safety conditions and if unsafe alerts to pushove.

It also writes a file that can be used by the ASCOM Generic File Safety Monitor fi the safety.txt node is enabled.

label: settings
info:
Persistent setting for different parts of the dashboard. 
All options require a value.

label: sqm
info: Poll the Unihedron SQM-LE for sky quality data. This is fed to the SQM graph and the current value ot the user interface. It is also published to MQTT for other applications to use.

label: sun & moon
info: Every minute this flow runs to get the current sun and moon data.

label: system sttus
info:
This flow is for tracking the up/down status of computer systems involved in imagimg.

By it's nature it is very specific to the environment in which it runes. In my case I get system status from my Unifi controller which has been more reliable than ping checks.

label: tplink
info: An early version of the all sky camera used TP Link power plugs to control A/C power. Everything is now powered via power over ethernet so this is no longer needed but is left here in case it ever becomes useful in the future.

label: UI: Home
info: This contains all the user interface elements for the home page of the dashboard.

label: wx: avg wind
info: This handlet the average wind data from MQTT

label: wx: misc
info: This handles all other miscellaneous weather data from MQTT.

label: wx: pressure
info: This handles the barometric pressure data from MQTT.

label: wx: rain
info: This handles the rain data from MQTT

label: wx: temperatures
info: This handles the temperature data from MQTT.

label: wx: wind
info: This handles the wind data from MQTT

name: mqtt
info:
Environment variables must be specified for:
- ASTRODASH_MQTT_SERVER
- ASTRODASH_MQTT_PORT
- ASTRODASH_MQTT_USER
- ASTRODASH_MQTT_PASSWORD

return msg;

name: Next Server Transaction ID
every 15 minute
info: Aeris Weather updates forecasts once an hour but we update every 15 minutes to ensure a timely update.

name: for precipitation in forecast UI LED
Rain in region?
every 10 minutes
info:
The rate at which this data updates at Aeris is variable and depends on when weather stations send updates to Aeris. As such it could be very laggy.

We fetch every 10 minutes to try to get reasonably timely data without exhausitng our API allotment.

name: every 10 minutes
info: Aeris Weather updates doppler radar images every 2 minutes. We are fetching every 5 minutes to reduce our use of the API so as to not approach our limit.

name: every 15 minutes
info: Aeris Weather updates infrared satellite data every 15 minutes.

name: save the timestamp for use in the filename
save the timestamp for use in the filename
stash the timestamps into the message
stash the timestamps into the message
current forecast
current conditions
construct radar url
func:
msg.url = "https://maps.aerisapi.com/" + 
    env.get("ASTRODASH_AERIS_WEATHER_CLIENT_ID") + "_" +
    env.get("ASTRODASH_AERIS_WEATHER_CLIENT_SECRET") +
    "/radar/256x256/" +
    global.get("lattitude") + "," +
    global.get("longitude") + "," +
    global.get("map_zoom") +
    "/current.png";
    
return msg;

name: construct IR clouds url
Currrent conditions
info:
This section fetches current conditions so we can extract the cloud cover.

Unfortunately, the cloud cover value seems only vaguely related to reality so don't give it too much weight in your decision making process.

name: IR Clouds Image
info:
This section fetches the infrared clouds satellite image.

This is a very epensive call in the Aeris Weather API so you should limit the number of times per hour it is called. 

See https://www.aerisweather.com/support/kb/maps/what-is-a-map-unit/ to understand Aeris Weather map units (they add up fast!) and

name: Doppler Radar Image
info:
This section fetches the doppler radar image.

This is a very epensive call in the Aeris Weather API so you should limit the number of times per hour it is called. 

See https://www.aerisweather.com/support/kb/maps/what-is-a-map-unit/ to understand Aeris Weather map units (they add up fast!) and

name: Rain in Region?
info:
This section fetches observation reports from weather stations within 25 miles. If any is reporting precipitation then we publish that info to MQTT and also update the user interface.

It fetches observatiosn within 25 miles and the exact number of results returned will depend on the actual number of reporting weather stations.

name: Forecast
info: We use the forecast api to get text forecasts for the UI as well as probability of precipitation and forecast precipitation amounts for alerting.

name: handle errors
info: if an exception happens, alert the user via the UI and pushover.

name: ui out: aeris api (rain in region)
convert to most convenient unit

name: styles for aeris maps
format:
<style>
    .aeris_outer_container {
        position: static;
        margin: auto auto;
        width: 256px;
        height: 256px;
    }
    .aeris_container {
    	width: 256px;
    	height: 256px;
        position: relative;
        /*margin-top: 4px;
        margin-bottom: 4px;
        margin-left: 1px;
        margin-right: 1px;*/
    }
    .aeris_box {
    	width: 100%;
    	height: 100%;
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
    }
    .aeris_cloud_box {
    	width: 100%;
    	height: 100%;
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
    }
    .aeris_cloud_admin {
        width: 100%;
        height: 100%;
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
        opacity: 0.25;
    }
    .aeris_radar_box {
    	width: 100%;
    	height: 100%;
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
        background-image: url("/aeris/radar-background.png");
    }    
    .aeris_data {
        opacity: 0.8;
    }

    .aeris_overlay {
  		position: absolute;
  		width: 100%;
  		height: 100%;
  		top: 0;
  		left: 0;
  		/* other styles (left, top, right, and padding) */
		background: rgba(77, 77, 77, 0.5);
		opacity: 0;
		z-index: 20;
    }
    .aeris_overlay:hover {
    	opacity: 1;
    }
	.aeris_text {
		position: relative;
		text-align: center;
		width: 100%;
		top: 25%;
		left: 0;
		color: #eeeeee;
		background-color: black;
	}
	.aeris_crosshair {
		position: absolute;
		display: block;
		z-index: 10;
		top: 108px;
		left: 108px;
		opacity: .40;
	}
</style>

name: All Sky Styles
format:
<style>
    img.cropped {object-fit: cover}

    .allsky_container {
        position: static;
        margin: auto auto;
        width: 630px;
        height: 530px;
    }
    .allsky_container {
    	width: 630px;
    	height: 530px;
        position: relative;
        /*margin-top: 4px;
        margin-bottom: 4px;
        margin-left: 1px;
        margin-right: 1px;*/
    }
    .allsky_box {
    	width: 100%;
    	height: 100%;
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
    }

    .allsky_overlay {
  		position: absolute;
  		width: 100%;
  		height: 100%;
  		top: 0;
  		left: 0;
  		/* other styles (left, top, right, and padding) */
		background: rgba(55, 55, 55, 0.5);
		opacity: 0;
    }
    .allsky_overlay:hover {
    	opacity: 1;
    }
	.allsky_text {
		position: relative;
		text-align: center;
		width: 100%;
		top: 25%;
		left: 0;
		color: #eeeeee;
	}
</style>

name: create and format wind structure
compass styles
format:
<style>
     @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Roboto:wght@300&display=swap');
     
     .compass_container{
        transition: 1s ease-in-out;
        position: relative;
        display: none;
        width: 500px;
        height: 500px;
        border-radius: 100%;
        font-family: 'Roboto';
        font-size: 80px;
        box-shadow: inset 0px 0px 0px 10px #777; 
        background-color: khaki;
        margin: 0 auto;
     }
     
     .compass_container .compass_header{
        font-weight: bold;
        position: absolute;
        text-align: center;
        width: 100%;
        font-size: 75%;
        top: -15px
     }
     .compass_container .text_container{
        height: 100%;
        width: 100%;
        padding: 0px;
        display: block;
        border-radius: 100%;
        display: flex;
        flex-direction: column;
        justify-content: center;
        align-items: center;
        opacity: 1;
     }
     
     .compass_container .arrow{
        transition: 1s ease-in-out;
        width: 100%;
        height: 100%;
        display: block;
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
     }
     
     .compass_container .arrow .triangle{
	    position: absolute;
        width: 0;
        height: 0;
        border-left: 15px solid transparent;
        border-right: 15px solid transparent;
        border-top: 75px solid #1F39D8;
        border-radius: 50%;
        top: -15px;
	    left: 50%;
	    margin-left: -15px;
	    z-index: 99;
     }
</style>
